articles.content: Unlike EA and Ubisoft, with EA Play 2020 and Ubisoft Forward respectively, it sounds like Square Enix won't be holding its own digital showcase to make up for the fact that there's no E3 this year. According to journalist Takashi Mochizuki, the Japanese publi… [+631 chars]

articles.author: Sean Keach
articles.title: Google’s free Zoom rival lets you call 100 people with NO time limit – how to get it - The Sun
articles.content:
GOOGLE'S Meet video-calling app is now completely free with no time limits.
And the Zoom rival lets you create group video calls with up to 100 people at once.
Google Meet is now available for everyone for free
Previously, Google Meet could only be used by… [+2186 chars]

articles.title: Google Play Music Is Dying: Don’t Let It Take Your MP3 Collection With It - Forbes
articles.description: Google has finally announced it’s killing off Play Music before the end of the year - here's how to make sure it doesn't take your music library with it
articles.content:
Google Play Music is closing before the year's out
Getty
Google has finally announced its killing off Play Music before the end of the year. Now millions of customers who may have uploaded their MP3 collection to the service need to make sure they dont lose… [+2216 chars]

articles.author: Sean Carey
articles.title: The Culling is coming back, but with possibly the most punishing monetisation model ever - TrueAchievements
articles.description: The Culling is getting released again on the Xbox One. This time, the game includes better graphics, better AI and a shockingly bad monetisation system that only allows you to play online once per day.
articles.content: The battle royale title, The Culling, is once again returning to Xbox One, this time with several changes, including better graphics, better AI and possibly one of the most punishing monetisation models ever seen. The Culling: Origins will cost $5.99, however… [+1856 chars]

articles.title: Dell XPS 17 2020 release date, price, specs and screen - TrustedReviews
articles.description: Rumours have swirled about a new Dell XPS 17 2020 and it’s finally here. The XPS 17 isn’t messing around either and could challenge Apple's MacBook Pro 16.
articles.content:
Rumours have swirled about a return for the Dell XPS 17 2020, and its finally here. The XPS 17 isnt back to mess around either and could seriously challenge Apples MacBook Pro 16 crown.
